name: Chinese Bean Sprout Salad
instruction:
Step 1: Preheat oven to 300F

Step 2: Toast the sesame seeds over a pie tin for about 12 to 16 minutes.

Step 3: In a medium size skillet over low heat, stir fry the garlic,scallions and ginger in the oil for 2 to 3 minutes

Step 4: Add all the remaining ingredients, increase the heat to moderate, then boil the mixture for 1 minute

Step 5: Pour the dressing over the bean sprouts, chill the salad for several hours. Toss before serving.
tip: Add 0.25 lb such as chicken and add 0.25 grains such as rice to complete the meal.

name: Beef and Broccoli
instruction:
Step 1: Cut your beef into thin slices

Step 2: Add 2 tables spoons of soy sauce and 3 table spoons full of corn starch. add your beef and mix.

Step 3: Add a coat of oil to your wok at least 3 centimeters deep. Heat your Wok

Step 4: Add your beef and cook until it half done. Drain your wok and wipe it out. Put the beef to the side

Step 5: Cook the broccoli half way through, then add your beef back into the wok. Stir fry the beef.

Step 6: Add on about 1 1/2 teaspoon of seaseme seed oil and 1 tablespoon of oyster sauce. Add 1/4 a cup of chicken of chicken stock.
tip: To complete your meal, consider adding in 0.25lb beef and 0.5lb of grains such rice or noodles.

name: Stir Fried Chicken
instruction:
Step 1: Saute the garlic and red chilli in hot olive oil

Step 2: Add soya sauce,oyster sauce, fish sauce and chicken and then saute

Step 3: Add red pepper, yellow pepper, salt, basil leaves and water

Step 4: Cook the chicken through

Step 5: Serve
tip: To finish your meal consider adding 0.5lb of grains such as rice or noodles. Also consider adding 0.25 lbs of additional chicken

name: Chinese Fried Rice
instruction:
Step 1: Put first four ingredients in a mixing bowl and stir. Eggs should not be beaten heavily.

Step 2: Heat wok. Add the oil. Brown the garlic and ginger, then add the rice. Cook for 23 minutes, stir the rice.

Step 3: Add the rest of the ingredients except the eggs.

Step 4: Fry and stir constantly until thoroughly mixed. Add the eggs while stirring the rice.

Step 5: Cook about 2 minutes, make sure to stir. Serve while hot.
tip: To complete your meal add 1.375 lbs of vegetables, such as broccoli or green beans.

name: Hunan Lamb
instruction:
Step 1: Combine marinade ingredients in a bowl. Add lamb and stir. Leave mixture for 10 minutes.

Step 2: Combine sauce ingredients.

Step 3: Place broccoli in a large pot with 1 inch of boiling water. Boil until tende, 2 to 3 minutes; drain.

Step 4: Place a wok over high heat. Add oil and coat the sides. Add garlic and chilies and cook while stirring. Add lamb and stir fry for about 1 1/2 to 2 minutes.

Step 5: Add broccoli and sauce to wok; bring to a boil. Add cornstarch solution and cook, stir until sauce thickens.
tip: To complete your meal, consider adding 0.25 lbs of protein. Tofu is great source of protein. Also consider adding rice.

name: Moo Goo Gai Pan
instruction:
Step 1: In a bowl, mix the chicken with the salt and pepper, garlic and cornstarch mixture. Set aside.

Step 2: Heat 3 tablespoons of corn oil in a wok and stir in mushrooms, bok choy/cabbage and sugar for 2 minutes. Cook for 5 minutes. Remove from wok.

Step 3: Heat corn oil in wok. Using high heat, stir fry the chicken for 2 minutes. Add soy sauce and mix. Cover and cook for about 6 minutes.

Step 4: Mix the vegetables and scallions in. Stir fry together for about 1 minute. Serve hot with rice.
tip: To complete your meal, consider adding 0.5 lbs of grains such as rice.

name: Hunan Chili Chicken
instruction:
Step 1: Mix the chicken with marinade mixture. Combine sauce ingredients and set aside. Make up cornstarch mixture and set aside. 

Step 2: Cut the bell pepper pieces. Heat 1 1/2 cups oil in wok until smoking. Add chicken and stir constantly until shreds separate and are cooked. 

Step 3: Remove chicken and place in bowl. Pour off all but 2 Tbsp of the oil from the wok. When hot, add the sauce mixture and stir together over medium heat for 30 seconds to 1 minute.

Step 4: Return chicken pieces to wok and toss. Add cornstarch mixture and stir until sauce thickens.

Step 5: Add the bell pepper pieces, stir the mixture, cooking for about 1 minute.
tip: To complete your meal. consider serving your meal with 0.625 lbs of rice and adding in 0.625 lbs of additional vegetables such stir fried green beans.

name: Shrimp and Noodle Stir Fry
instruction:
Step 1: Heat a large skillet, when hot add oil and chili paste

Step 2: Add the shrimp and bell pepper, stir the shrimp and bell peppers for about 2 to 3 minutes.

Step 3: Add noodles, chicken broth and vinegar

Step 4: Add green onions and cilantro 

Step 5: Remove the skillet from the heat and serve with peanuts
tip: To complete your meal. consider adding in an additional 0.25lbs of noodles and 0.5 lb of extra bell peppers

name: Chinese Chicken with Cashew Nuts
instruction:
Step 1: Remove skin from chicken and dice the chicken into small pieces

Step 2: Marinade the chicken 

Step 3: Coat a pan with oil and cook the onions and garlic

Step 4: Stir fry the chicken and vegetables

Step 5: Add cashews and cornflour stir until it thickens then serve
tip: To complete your meal consider adding 0.5 lbs of rice.

name: General Tsao's Chicken
instruction:
Step 1: Mix 1/2 cup cornstarch and water

Step 2: Add garlic, ginger, sugar, 1/2 cup soy sauce, vinegar, wine ,chicken broth and stir

Step 3: Mix the chicken with 1/4 cup soy sauce, white pepper, 1 egg, 1 cup cornstarch.

Step 4: Add vegetable oil to seperate the chicken, then fry the chicken

Step 5: Heat your wok, then add onions, peppers and the sauce and stir.

Step 6: Place the chicken in with the sauce and cook until sauce is thick
tip: To finish your meal, consider adding in 1.5 lbs of vegetables such as snow peas and 0.75lbs of grains

name: Kung Pao Chicken
instruction:
Step 1: Mix the chicken, 1 and 1/2 tablespoons of cornstarch, water and 1 tablespoon of soy sauce, let it marinate for half an hour

Step 2: Mix the seasoning sauce

Step 3: Cook the chicken and put it to the side

Step 4: Stir fry the hot dried red peppers and ginger

Step 5: Add the seasoning sauce, chicken, scallions, green peppers and red peppers. 

Step 6: Remove the pan from the heat and serve with peanuts
tip: To finish your meal, consider adding in 0.625 lbs of vegetables such as brocolli and 0.5 lbs of grains like rice and noodles

name: Chinese Pasta Salad
instruction:
Step 1: Wash the snow peas and place them in boiling water for 10 minutes

Step 2: Cook the noodles

Step 3: Combine the noodles, snow peas, red pepper, cucumber, shrimp and crabmeat

Step 4: Combine ginger, garlic, sesame oil, pepper, salt, vegetable oil, lemon juice and vinegar.

Step 5: Mix all the ingredients
tip: Cutting down on 0.25 lbs of shrimp would be ideal for this dish.

name: Chinese Hunan Beef
instruction:
Step 1: Combine 2 tablespoons of soy sauce, 2 teaspoons cornstarch, 1 tablespoon chinese rice wine, 3/4 pound flank steak(thinnly sliced), let the mixture marinate

Step 2: Combine sauce ingredients

Step 3: Boil the broccoli

Step 4: Cook the garlic and chillies in a wok for about 10 seconds, than add the beef and stir fry.

Step 5: Add sauce, broccoli and cornstarch, then stir until sauce is thick
tip: Consider adding a pound of rice or any other grains to your meal.

name: Shrimp with Snow Peas
instruction:
Step 1: Shell the prawns and mix with marinade(1 and 1/2 tsp sherry, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp grated ginger, 1 and 1/2 tsp cornstarch and 1 tsp water), let it sit for 30 mins

Step 2: Stir fry garlic in a wok for 15 secs

Step 3: Stir fry prawns until cooked through, than remove from wok

Step 4: Add salt, snow peas, seasoning sauce to wok.

Step 5: Add cooked prawns to the wok, coat everything with sauce than serve
tip: Consider serving this dish with 1 lb of rice or any other grains and adding 1.5 lbs of vegetables of your choice.

name: Lo Mein
instruction:
Step 1: Mix sugar and soy sauce

Step 2: Add vegetable oil and sesame oil in a wok, then add ginger and garlic. After you add the ginger and garlic, add the other vegetables

Step 3: Add sherry and cook for another minute, then remove the vegetables.

Step 4: Cook the noodle, meat and vegetables. 

Step 5: Add soy sauce and stir, than serve.
tip: Consider adding in an additional 0.25 lbs of green beans to your meal.

name: Sichuan Style Stir-Fired Chinese Long Beans
instruction:
Step 1: Add the peanut oil to the wok, than stir fry the chillies and peppers

Step 2: Stir fry the long beans for a couple of minutes, than add salt and sugar.

Step 3: Stir in sesame oil and soy sauce, than serve.
tip: Consider serving this dish with a dish that contains 1.5 lbs of vegetables, 1 lb of grains and 1 lb of meat.

name: Sichuan Eggplant
instruction:
Step 1: Chop the eggplant and mix with chicken stock, sugar and soy sauce. Mix chili bean paste, garlic, ginger and sichuan peppercorns in a seperate bowl. Mix cornstarch with water in seperate bowl. Mix scallions and vinegar.

Step 2: Cook the eggplant in a wok

Step 3: Add the chili bean paste, garlic, ginger, peppercorns and saute. Than add chicken stock mixture, cook for 90 seconds, than add the cornstarch mixture, than add the scallions and vinegar and cook. Add cilantro than serve.
tip: Consider serving this dish with 1 lb of rice.

name: Hot Sour Soup
instruction:
Step 1: Boil mushrooms and cut the mushrooms into strips

Step 2: Boil lily buds

Step 3: Mix vinegar and soy sauce and cut the bamboo shoots

Step 4: Boil the chicken broth, than add tofu, mushrooms, lily buds, bamboo shoots, vinegar mixture and cornstarch mixture

Step 5: Take the soup off the heat, stir the soup and add the egg

Step 6: Add scallions, white pepper, sesame oil and chili oil, than serve.
tip: Consider serving this dish with 0.625 lbs of vegetables of your choice and 0.5 lb of noodles

name: Sweet and Sour Chicken
instruction:
Step 1: Mix chicken with egg whites, salt and cornstarch

Step 2: Mix pineapple juice, vinegar, ketchup, salt and sugar

Step 3: Stir fry the chicken, remove the chicken when it is partially cooked

Step 4: Stir fry the bell peppers and ginger

Step 5: Add the pineapple, sweet sour sauce and chicken. Let it simmer.
tip: Consider serving this dish with 0.5 lb of rice or noodles

name: Chicken Lettuce Wrap
instruction:
Step 1: Combine soy sauce, rice wine, oyster sauce and water

Step 2: Saute the onions, garlic and ginger for two minutes, than add zucchini, ground meat, water chestnuts, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. 

Step 3: Stir in soy sauce, oyster sauce, rice wine and water.

Step 4: Pressure cook the chicken

Step 5: Serve chicken in lettuce. Top with green onions, chopped peanuts and cilantro.
tip: Consider serving 0.25 lb of rice on the side.

name: Flank Steak Stir-fry with Asparagus and Red Pepper
instruction:
Step 1: Blanch the asparagus

Step 2: Mix soy sauce, chopped ginger, minced garlic, chopped green onion and chili oil

Step 3: Stir fry asparagus, than remove. Stir fry beef strips 

Step 4: Stir fry the bell peppers

Step 5: Add cornstarch mixture, sauce and asparagus. Serve with rice.
tip: Consider serving with 0.5 lb of grains of your choice

name: Egg-drop Soup
instruction:
Step 1: Save 1/2 cup of chicken stock, mix the cornstarch with stock

Step 2: Boil the stock, ginger, soy sauce, onions, mushrooms, white pepper. Add in the cornstarch mixture.

Step 3: Stir in the beaten eggs and than serve
tip: Consider adding 0.75 lbs of vegetables like corn and 0.5 lbs of noodles.

name: Stir-fried Green Beans with Ginger and Onions
instruction:
Step 1: Cook the green beans, onions, ginger and garlic in wok. 

Step 2: Add soy sauce and sugar and than stir fry the mixture.

Step 3: Mix in the sesame oil and black pepper, than serve.
tip: Consider serving with 0.5 lbs of rice and 0.5 lbs beef.

name: Mushroom Stir-fry with Peas and Green Onions
instruction:
Step 1: Make glaze(1/4 cup chicken stock, 1 tablespoon honey, 1 teaspoon soy sauce) and make sauce(1/2 chicken stock, 3 tablespoons soy sauce, 1/4 cup honey, 1 tablespoon rice vinegar, 1 tablespoon cooking wine, 1 tablespoon cornstarch)

Step 2: Saute the mushrooms in a wok for a couple of minutes. Add in the glaze. Remove the mushrooms.

Step 3: Add in the garlic, ginger and chilies.

Step 4: Add in snow peas and onions

Step 5: Add back in the mushrooms and the sauce, than serve.
tip: Consider adding 1.3 lbs of vegetables and serving with 0.6 lbs of rice

name: Chinese Chicken Salad
instruction:
Step 1: Combine all the ingredients except the noodles

Step 2: Add the dressing and mix

Step 3: Add the noodles.
tip: Try adding in additional cabbage to your suit your liking.

name: Zucchini Fries
instruction:
Step 1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit. Cut zucchini into fry-shaped pieces. 

 Step 2: On a plate, put corn starch, salt, and pepper together, mix the zucchini into the mixture. Dip the zucchini fries into the egg mixture, then press into bread crumbs. Place the breaded zucchini onto a baking sheet. 

 Step 3: Bake for 15 minutes or until fries are golden brown.
tip: Try serving with a side of 0.25 lbs of rice

name: Steamed Butternut Squash
instruction:
Step 1: Fill the bottom of the steamer with 2 inches of water.

 Step 2: While steam is building up in steamer, peel and cut squash into 1-inch cubes.

 Step 3: Steam covered for 7 minutes. Squash is done when it is tender, yet still firm enough to hold its shape.

 Step 4: Transfer to a bowl. Mix the brown sugar with the margarine. Toss hot squash with the margarine and brown sugar mixture.
tip: Consider serving with 0.25 lbs of grains of your choice and 0.25 lbs of chicken.

name: Roasted Cauliflower
instruction:
Step 1: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.

 Step 2: Toss the cauliflower with the olive oil, garlic, and put on a baking sheet; sprinkle with the salt and toss again. Roast until golden and tender, about 20 minutes. 

 Step 3: Transfer to a serving bowl and serve.  Sprinkle with pepper.
tip: Consider serving with 0.25 lbs of rice and 0.25 lbs of a meat of your choice

name: Stir Fry Mushrooms
instruction:
Step 1: Wash all the mushrooms

Step 2: Heat oil until really hot

Step 3: Stir fry pleurotus eryngii (1 minute), then add rest of mushrooms, stir-fry until it becomes a bit soft (about 2 minutes).

Step 4: Add the oyster sauce and continue to stir for 2 minutes

Step 5: When done, remove from heat and serve
tip: Consider serving with 0.25 lbs of rice and 0.5 lbs of vegetables of your choice

name: Corn and Water Chestnut Soup
instruction:
Step 1: Rinse chestnut well under warm water. Peel with a knife of peeler (like you would an apple) the skin of the water chestnut

Step 2: Cut water chestnuts in half, sweet corn in sections and carrots into pieces

Step 3: Put all the ingredients into a pan and pour in water until just enough to immerse all the igredients

Step 4: Bring to a boil over high heat, then turn to low heat and simmer till the carrot is soften.
tip: Consider adding 0.25 lbs of Chicken to your meal.

name: Assorted Veggies Casserole Recipe
instruction:
Step 1: Heat up cooking oil in wok till hot. Stir fry the minced garlic and ginger till aromatic. Add carrots, black fungus and shiitake mushroom. Stir fry briefly until they get soften.

Step 2: Add the rest of the vegetables (Chinese cabbage, broccoli, cauliflower and sweet peas) with a small splash of water. Stir fry briefly until the cabbage starts to soften.

Step 3: Add in all the seasoning except for the stock and water. Mix well.

Step 4: Add in the stock and water and allow the sauce to cook till it boils before lowering the heat. Allow it to simmer on low heat till the sauce thickens.
tip: Consider serving this over 0.25 lbs of your choice grain.

name: Rice Cooker Tomato Rice
instruction:
Step 1: Wash rice as normal. Place the rice in a pot and add water to the appropriate level indicated in the pot.

Step 2: Remove 6 tbsp. of water from the pot (for the water amount of tomato), then add salt, pepper, and olive oil, and mix well.

Step 3: Remove stem of tomato from top (and the bottom if you want), make a crisscross at its bottom. Place the tomato in the middle of the pot, and other ingredients the way you like.

Step 4: Put the pot into the rice cooker. Cover and press the button to start. 

Step 5: When done, toss the rice along with tomato and other ingredients lightly using a rice paddle, then its ready to serve.
tip: Consider adding in 0.25 lbs of your choice of meat.

name: Steamed Asparagis With Mint And Lime
instruction:
Step 1: In a large pot, bring water to a boil and add salt.

Step 2: Place trimmed asparagus into boiling water and blanch until tender. Drain and set aside to cool on a serving plate.

Step 3: Drizzle olive oil and squeeze lime over asparagus. Sprinkle mint leaves to garnish.

Step 4: Serve warm.
tip: Consider serving with 0.25 lbs of your choice of grains and 0.25 lbs of your choice of meat.

name: Vietnamese Salad Roll
instruction:
Step 1: Bring a medium saucepan of water to boil. Place rice vermicelli in boiling water, remove from heat, and let soak 3 to 5 minutes, until soft. Drain, and rinse with cold water.

Step 2: Fill a large bowl with warm water. Dip one rice wrapper in the water for a few second to soften. Lay wrapper flat on a dry towel and brush on hoisin sauce.

Step 3: Place desired amounts of noodles, tofu, vegetables and basil in the center. Roll the edges of the wrapper slightly inward. Beginning at the bottom edge of wrapper, tightly wrap the ingredients. Repeat with remaining ingredients.

Step 4: Serve immediately.
tip: Consider adding in an additional 0.5 lbs of carrots to your dish.

name: Stir Fried Cucumber and Wood Ear Mushrooms with Cashews
instruction:
Step 1: Soak mushrooms in water until hydrated, 

Step 2: Blanch, drain and once cool trim off any tough sections.

Step 3: Add oil into wok and over medium heat stir fry vegetables until tender.

Step 4: Add remaining ingredients and toss together.

Step 5: Serve as a side dish with rice.
tip: Consider serving this dish with .25 lbs of your choice of grains.

name: Kale Chips
instruction:
Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. 

Step 2: De-stem kale tear into bite size pieces. 

Step 3: Wash and thoroughly dry kale with a salad spinner. 

Step 4: Drizzle kale with oil and sprinkle with seasoning salt.

Step 5: Bake until the edges brown  approximately 10 minutes.

Step 6: Serve immediately.
tip: Consider serving 0.05 lbs of your choice of grains and 0.05 lbs of your choice of meat.

name: Chinese Eggplant With Black Bean Sauce
instruction:
Step 1: Heat saucepan on medium high heat. Add oil  heat until hot but not smoky. 

Step 2: Add minced ginger, garlic, white part of scallion and salt. Cook to soften. Add fermented black beans and chopped onions. Cook to soften. Add oyster sauce and rice vinegar. Add eggplants and mix well. 

Step 3: Add red pepper flakes, if using. Bake covered in oven for 10 minutes. 

Step 4: Taste and add soy sauce, if needed. Garnish with green part of scallions and cilantro, if using.
tip: Consider serving with 0.25 lbs of your choice of grains and 0.25 lbs of your choice of meat

name: Beet and Bone Broth
instruction:
Step 1: Rinse chicken or pork bones under cold running water until clear.

Step 2: Place all ingredients into a pressure cooker.

Step 3: Cook for 25 minutes under the high pressure setting.

Step 4: Allow steam to naturally release.

Step 5: Skim fat before serving.
tip: Considering serving this dish with 0.5 lbs of your choice of grains and 0.5 lbs of your choice of meat
